bsh
Class PlexReader

java.lang.Object
  java.io.Reader
      java.io.FilterReader
          bsh.PlexReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.lang.Readable
public class PlexReader
extends java.io.FilterReader

The PlexReader class is a wrapper for the input Reader for interactive Interpreter instances. We intercept the read() operations, and when input logging is enabled, we write (with conversion if needed) the chars read() into a log file. Such a file can be read and executed later via the source() command, for instance.

setLogfile

Force logstream to go to specified filename.

Parameters:
new_log_name - Name to use as logfile -- must be the name of a writable file.

read

public int read(char[] buf,
                int off,
                int len)
         throws java.io.IOException
Wrapper for normal read to buffer operation. If logging is on, log the characters that were read, otherwise, do nothing.

Overrides:
read in class java.io.FilterReader
Parameters:
buf - Where to write the characters read.
off - Offset at which to start writing the characters.
len - Max number of characters to read.
Returns:
Number of characters read.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

setDefaultFlag

public static void setDefaultFlag(boolean flag)
Set the default logging flag. The default default is false. Invoked via the setLogging() command.

Parameters:
flag - If true, input logging is on by default, else off.

log_status

public java.lang.String log_status()
Return a String describing the logging status, including defaults.

Returns:
Log status string.

setDefaultDir

public static void setDefaultDir(java.lang.String pathname)
Set the default logging directory. The default default is ~/plex. Invoked via the setLogging() command.

Parameters:
pathname - Set the default directory in which to store log files.
